kdl.prox.qged
Class QueryCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              edu.umd.cs.piccolo.PCanvas
                  kdl.prox.qged.QueryCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.umd.cs.piccolo.PComponent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class QueryCanvas
extends edu.umd.cs.piccolo.PCanvas

A PCanvas that knows how to create, display, and edit QGraph queries. For now this implementation uses Piccolo-style user attributes to associate domain objects (QGraph elements) with PNodes, rather than extending PNode with subclasses. We use the following naming convention to help identify PNode types, based on the QGraph element each node has associated with it (see QG_ELEMENT_KEY): PEdge (a PNode representing a QGEdge), PVertex (represents a QGVertex), or PSubquery (represents a Subquery).

See Also:
Serialized Form

calcArrowHead

public static float[][] calcArrowHead(java.awt.geom.Point2D startPoint,
                                      java.awt.geom.Point2D endPoint,
                                      int arrowHeadLen,
                                      int arrowHeadAngle,
                                      double arrowInset)
From: http://groups.google.com/groups?hl=en&lr=&threadm=5p5s2m%2498b%40hershey.cc.gatech.edu&rnum=9&prev=/groups%3Fhl%3Den%26lr%3D%26q%3Djava%2Bdraw%2Barrow%26btnG%3DSearch Computes an arrowhead polygon, located at the second point.

Parameters:
startPoint - first coordinate of the line
endPoint - second coordinate of the line (arrow head point goes here)
arrowHeadLen - length of the sides of the arrow head
arrowHeadAngle - angle between each side and the line in degrees
arrowInset - percent inset for base of arrow [0..1]
Returns:
xsAndYs - a 2-element array whose first element is float[4] xs and whose second element is float[4] ys. These are as passed to PPath.setPathToPolyline(float[] xp, float[] yp).

getTableModel

public static QGObjTableModel getTableModel(java.lang.Object object)
The returned tables vary depending on object's type. In all cases the table contains a property description in the left column, and the corresponding value in the right column. Here are the three cases:

a) Query: 

 +--------------+-------+
 | Type         | Query |
 +--------------+-------+
 | Name         | ...   |  ??
 +--------------+-------+
 | Description  | ...   |
 +--------------+-------+
 | Constraint 1 | ...   |  if any
 +--------------+-------+
 | Constraint 2 | ...   |
 +--------------+-------+
 | ...          |       |
 +--------------+-------+
b) Subquery: 
 +--------------+---------+
 | Type         | Subqery |
 +--------------+---------+
 | Annotation   | ...     |
 +--------------+---------+
c) QGItem: 
 +--------------+-------+
 | Type         | Edge  |  or 'Vertex'
 +--------------+-------+
 | Name         | ...   |
 +--------------+-------+
 | Annotation   | ...   |
 +--------------+-------+
 | Condition    | ...   |
 +--------------+-------+

Parameters:
object - a Query, Subquery, or QGItem whose content is being represented
Returns:
a QGObjTableModel that contains content from object, represented as a properties sheet/inspector

updateLink

public static void updateLink(edu.umd.cs.piccolo.nodes.PPath pEdge)
Updates the endpoints of the link to connect the nodes it depends on. Also updates the arrowhead's orientation, if there is one. Handles the case of multiple edges between pEdge's two vertices by drawing parallel lines between the nodes, like this: 
       ----->
 ( + ) -----> ( + )
       ----->

Handles the case of (possibly multiple) self-loop edges by drawing edges as squares looped and stacked under the vertex node, like this: 

   ( + )
     |  ^
     +--+
     |  ^
     +--+
     ...

Parameters:
pEdge - a node with a QG_ITEM_KEY that's an edge QGItem

updateLinksForQGVertex

public void updateLinksForQGVertex(QGVertex qgVertex)
Updates all PEdges connected to qgVertex's PVertex.

Parameters:
